Articles.Content:
You can always pick up a second copy when KSP is on sale - it's 40% off quite often

Might do that. To bad there are always so many cheap games during the big sales.^^

Don't know why it was necessary to lock all the threads about specific features in 0.24, not going to be possible to have any reasonable discussion of individual features in this thread for some time since the Hype Train was steered into it.
I'm practically vibrating in my chair, wanting to be out of work and home so I can try this. At least I got the download finished remotely, so it's ready to go.

Test first flight: Orbit, all starting contracts, several EVA reports over different biomes, banked >125K funds, landed on land, tall rocket fell over destroying pod and killing Jeb. OK. time for my "real" career..
OK, it's still not working and I have to go to work tomorrow so I'll just have to go to sleep without 0.24 . Hopefully all the issues will have been resolved tomorrow morning.

I got it from the KSP website.

You, sir, or ma'am....are a wizard! Let's found a church based around your godlike powers!

#ChurchOfRobotengineer

But it's StEaM *shudders*, I have an trollers hatred for Steam. I'll wait.

I had nothing but positive experience with steam, and I have around 40 games on it. Still, I will rather keep my independent KSP, If I have a choice. One less app to run on the background...

Call me stupid but how do you get Steam to actually launch the 64 bit version? Can do it manually or via the launcher but Steam itself just fires up the 32 bit one.

I think this is designed to start the x86 version, because the other is more beta-ish then KSP itself
I think, at this point, it might be faster to register for Steam and purchase the game there. I would, if I didn't have to pay a lot for it at this point (got KSP for $15 with version 0.14.)
Nice work, downloading.
Whenever I attempt to download the new version, a screen pops up saying 'Parse error: syntax error, unexpected end of file in /host/www.kerbalspaceprogram.com/htdocs/lib/multiplayDwn.php on line 132'
Progress seems to be happening on the KSP Store server, seems to be getting quicker at serving error messages now.
Finally got a DL to start from the KSP webpage. Still no luck getting the patcher to work.
KSP webpage is fixed!
Download underway. Come to papa, you 64-bit beauty!
When it downloads, it goes fast. 4mbps.
The Line 132 error seems to be gone, for me. Downloading at the current time (33 min remaining due to crazy drastic server load.)
Just brings me to a blank page. Nothing downloaded.
I get a blank page with no error now.

I think, at this point, it might be faster to register for Steam and purchase the game there. I would, if I didn't have to pay a lot for it at this point (got KSP for $15 with version 0.14.)

nah, sit back and remember that KSP is still in heavy development. it will be years before the final product. You can afford to wait extra 1- 5 hours for a update...

OK, it's still not working and I have to go to work tomorrow so I'll just have to go to sleep without 0.24 . Hopefully all the issues will have been resolved tomorrow morning.

I got it to start downloading right after I posted this. Yeah!
Try logging out and logging in again. I had cookie issues but that fixed it for me.
Oh great! I got a 500 Internal Server Error!
Took about 3 mins to download.
How do you pick up a stranded kerbal?
